definition: medium/intermediary/matchmaker/go-between/abbr. for 媒體|媒体[mei2 ti3], media, esp. news media

sentences.english: There are a lot of vivid professional match-makers in Baihua novels in late Ming dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 晚明白話小說中塑造了大量栩栩如生的職業媒妁形象。

sentences.english: Chapter 1 involves examining the origin and development of Matchmaker.
sentences.chinese: 第一章重在探討“媒妁”的源流辨析問題。

sentences.english: In Egypt, many marriages are arranged.
sentences.chinese: 許多婚姻還是父母之命，媒妁之言。

sentences.english: Matchmaking has existed since ancient times in Russia.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯自古以來就有媒妁婚姻形式。

sentences.english: We don't need their parents' orders and won't listen to by matchmakers' help.
sentences.chinese: 我們不需要他們的父母的命令，不聽媒妁之言。

sentences.english: Your mother and I was an arranged marriage.

definition: forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)
to act as go-between (between prospective marriage partners etc)

to enquire, according to custom, after the name and horoscope of intended bride/one of a set of six traditional marriage protocols (六禮|六礼), in which name as well as date and time of birth (for horoscope) are formally requested of the prospective bride's family
variant of 訂婚|订婚[ding4 hun1]
